summary: Robin D. Lindley was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). The documents available are payroll and certification reports that list Lindley's name, salary, and employment dates. Lindley was employed by the SCAS at least from April 1978 to December 1978. The specific role Lindley held within the SCAS is not detailed in these documents, but the documents confirm Lindley was a paid staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: Robin D. Lindley's significance lies in being a staff member of the Select Committee on Assassinations, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. The specific contributions are not detailed in these documents.
